text: Maybe Tom Cruise doesn't fit the role perfectly, but the film has that Reacher aura and I found it very good, I watched it at least three or four times...
Dark tense creepy film . Tom Cruise as Jack Reacher kicks everybodys ass . Good cast doing a good job giving us our moneys worth .

A surprisingly good action thriller where the action wasn’t too overdone and the plot stood up. Actually enjoyed this one. It’s like mission impossible stripped of most of the impossibility. Watched on Amazon Prime.

Filme mais ou menos, o roteiro é fraco, as cenas são mais ou menos, a história é fraca, o elenco é fraco, e ninguém ajuda a melhorar o filme, os personagens são fracos, e o filme deveria ter cenas bem melhores e relevantes, para fazer o filme ser bom

The entire cast and script is to set up Cruise as an unstoppable, genius, superhuman killer, yet the plot devices and moments don't quite work. The dialogue is cheesy. The plot is convuluted and forgettable. The scenes and Pittsburgh looks great. The sound design and overall the first scene of the sniping is really good. It has some interesting things going on, but overall not a good movie.
good Tom Cruise action thriller

Wow, Tom Cruise never disappoints! I just watched these films on Netflix after over 12 years, and they’re fantastic. Cruise shines as both actor and producer, always delivering quality movies. The first film was great, but the second was even better—like his Top Gun films, they’re thrilling and well-made. Don’t listen to the bad reviews; these movies are definitely worth watching!

One of the film's greatest strengths lies in its action sequences, which are both intense and expertly executed. Tom Cruise gives a strong performance as Jack Reacher, demonstrating his charisma and prowess as an action star.

Brilliant! The start of ... , well, you know what. Epic. McQuarrie at his best here. Tom Cruise brings every little detail to this character successfully and with ease. Gritty, intense, analytical, twists and turns, great action and enough suspense. Cinematography is upper class. Whole cast excels in character. The best Reacher imo, highly recommended
Definitely the best jack Reacher ever.
A successful action movie in 2 hours and 10 minutes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!l

In the film "Jack Reacher" Tom Cruise essentially plays the same Ethan Hunt. But here he is absolutely free.

He does not depend on his superiors, colleagues or missions. He is a kind of tramp from old westerns mixed with detectives from the 40s.

The plot of the film is a pure detective story, then it is a thriller and only then Tom Cruise's genre - an action movie.

The film has excellently staged fights, the main character misses one blow after another, uses techniques that a military man or a special forces person could use. Despite the fact that there are many action scenes in the film, the film itself is rather slow compared to other works of Cruise.

I really liked the motley crew of antagonists. Imagine that the producers and screenwriters discussed who to take for these roles.

Our team of villains is:
- German director (Werner Herzog)
- Not a very good Australian actor (Jai Courtney)
- Bodybuilder of Russian origin (Vladimir Sizov)

Who came up with this cast? I don't know, but it was perfect.

"Jack Reacher" is a thriller-detective in which all the necessary ingredients for this genre come together at once.
Fun action heavy movie and definitely worth a watch!! Just and FYI if you want to watch a better version of Jack reacher I highly recommend the tv show.
A below-average action thriller.

Finally watched this on Netflix- It’s a solid crime detective movie, and Tom Cruise nails the role. I know some folks say he’s not right for it because he’s not 6'4", but if you haven’t read the book, he totally owns it. The pacing’s tight with no wasted scenes, and the chemistry between Tom and Rosamund is legit. If you’re into crime-solving movies, definitely check it out.

Despite his size, Tom Cruise effortlessly captures the essence of Jack Reacher in this first adaptation of Lee Child's titular ex-military police investigator. The film is a thoroughly entertaining crime thriller, featuring a standout scene—a creative beatdown in an upstairs hallway. Werner Herzog, as the head of a criminal organization, portrays a mysterious and haunting individual. His chilling accent perfectly complements the character's enigmatic persona.
Well, It's not really an action movie, unlike Mission Impossible. It's more of a drama story, sometimes a little bit boring/ to much talking/ too long scenes.: . That's why I give it a 2,5 out of 5.

Regardless of Tom Cruise's size, he was superior to the gentleman from the TV series. As usual, he makes every part he plays come alive and no one surpasses him. I have seen all of his movies more than once and appreciate him more each time!
Not a huge fan of Tom Cruise and think the movie could have been much more authentic with an actor more intimidating. Big fan of Rosamund Puke though so watched the movie.
Pretty good. Action maybe a bit lackluster here and there especially the final fight. But the story is very nice and the cast is great. Definitely a Tom Cruise classic.
